messages.emergencyAdviceFull:
If you're in custody or facing immediate arrest:

• **Stay calm** and don't resist
• **Exercise your right to remain silent** - politely say "I wish to remain silent"
• **Ask for a lawyer** - say "I want a lawyer" and don't answer questions until one arrives
• **Don't consent to searches** - politely say "I don't consent to searches"

What would you like to do next?

messages.rightsMenu: What would you like to learn about?
messages.rightsInfo:
Here are your fundamental rights:

• **Right to remain silent** - You don't have to answer police questions
• **Right to an attorney** - You can have a lawyer present during questioning
• **Right against unreasonable searches** - Police generally need a warrant
• **Right to know the charges** - You must be informed of what you're accused of
• **Right to a fair trial** - You're innocent until proven guilty

What would you like to explore next?
messages.processInfo:
Here's an overview of the criminal justice process:

1. **Arrest** - You're taken into custody
2. **Booking** - Processing and fingerprinting
3. **Arraignment** - First court appearance, charges read
4. **Pretrial** - Discovery, motions, plea negotiations
5. **Trial** - If no plea deal, case goes to trial
6. **Sentencing** - If convicted, judge determines punishment

What would you like to explore next?

messages.immigrationSummary:
**Immigration Enforcement & Your Rights**

If you encounter immigration agents (ICE):

• You have the right to **remain silent** - you don't have to answer questions about your immigration status
• You have the right to **refuse to show documents** proving your status
• **Don't sign anything** without talking to a lawyer first
• **Don't lie** or provide false documents
• You have the right to a lawyer, though one won't be provided for you in immigration court

**If ICE comes to your door:**
• You don't have to open the door unless they have a signed judicial warrant
• Ask them to slip the warrant under the door
• ICE administrative warrants (Form I-200, I-205) do NOT give permission to enter

**Resources:**
• National Immigrant Justice Center: 312-660-1370
• ACLU Immigrant Rights: [aclu.org/know-your-rights](https://www.aclu.org/know-your-rights/immigrants-rights)

What else can I help you with?
